title: Prepare for release 0.9.0-rc1.
Update dependencies.
Update UI to v0.2.0.
Make publication point counters work.
body: This PR fixes an oversight that left the `valid-point` and `rejected-point` metrics at 0.

title: Better error message if database is locked.
body: Fixes #546.

title: Readme review
Fix Secure Transports doc
body:
The Secure Transports doc had outdated commands to start Routinator. This PR fixes that.

Alternatively, this document can be removed as it's part of the documentation [here](https://routinator.docs.nlnetlabs.nl/en/latest/daemon.html#secure-transports). The same applies to the [Miscellaneous Documentation Items](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/blob/main/doc/misc.md), which are documented [here](https://routinator.docs.nlnetlabs.nl/en/latest/installation-notes.html#statically-linked-routinator) and [here](https://routinator.docs.nlnetlabs.nl/en/latest/installation-notes.html#centos-6) along with a fair number of additions.

title: Update tal-labels example
LACNIC HTTPS TAL
body: As authoritatively stated by https://www.lacnic.net/4984/2/lacnic/rpki-rpki-trust-anchor

title: Re-enable Windows for CI workflow.
Clean up and extend Prometheus metrics.
body:
This PR adds the new metrics to the Prometheus metrics output and uses the opportunity to sanitize generation of these metrics a bit.

Resolves #494

title: Sort the deltas in an RRDP notification file.
body: This PR fixes an issue that prevented the RRDP collector from ever using deltas for updating.

title: Provide delta output in JSON under /json-delta.
body:
This PR provides a RTR-like delta output in JSON as the HTTP /json-delta endpoint.

Resolves #467

title: Full man page review
Fix parsing of vrps’s --format option.
body: What it says on the tin …

title: Don’t bubble up RRDP notification HTTP error.
body: This PR fixes an issue where any HTTP error during fetching of the RRDP notification file will be interpreted as a fatal error and Routinator will stop.

title: Limit maximum size of downloaded objects.
body:
This PR introduces the new config option `max-object-size` that limits the size of individual RPKI objects. It is enabled by default and set to 20 Mbytes. The largest object currently in the RPKI – RIPE’s manifest – is a bit over 1 Mbyte, so this should give a bit of buffer.

The limit is implemented in the RRDP client which simply stops processing and errors out when any published object exceeds the size limit. For rsync, we pass the `--max-size` option if no other options are provided.

Resolves #462

title: Don’t clean up if dirty-repository is enabled.
body: … or, strictly speaking, only clean up if dirty-repository is not enabled.

title: Log falling back to rsync only once per repository.
body: This PR fixes an annoyance where the message that a fallback to rsync had to happen is logged every single time a publication point from the affected repository is accessed.

title: Add a hard timeout to rsync processes.
body:
This PR turns the already existing `rsync-timeout` config option into a hard timeout on the rsync process.

Because this can’t be done with just the std library, we are using a current-thread Tokio runtime to do this via a set of futures.

Resolves #367.

title: Do not keep a collector in no-update mode.
body: This PR changes how we deal with the `--no-update` option available in some commands: We simply don’t use the collector at all. It changes the collector field in the engine to an option and adjusts various other types and methods to be able to cope with that.

title: Use the RRDP repository in the store even if the collector falls back.
body:
This PR changes the logic how a fallback from RRDP to rsync is dealt with in the store. Previously, we also switched the store to use the rsync repository in this case. Now we use the RRDP repository in the store instead while taking data from the rsync collector.

This means that the RRDP repository’s store is updated from data collected via rsync. This is, however, fine. The reason we keep the two separated is that RRDP can publish data for any rsync URI. Thus, two RRDP repositories can publish data for the same rsync URI. However, this is not what happens here: in this case we use rsync data for an RRDP repository. There will only ever be one source for rsync data since the authority is part of the identifier.

While an RRDP server can still use bogus rsync URIs, it isn’t supposed to and if it does shenanigans, it is its own fault.

So, this change should be safe. It also makes dealing with no-update runs much easier. Previously, we technically would need to know whether the last known state was via the RRDP repository or via the rsync repository because of fallback. Now it is always via the RRDP repository because in case of fallback, the data is added to the RRDP repository.

Fixes #509.

title: Improve documentation for RTR server metrics.
body: This PR is a follow-up to #519 which was merged accidentally. It attempts to better explain how everything works. It also makes the fields of `RtrClientMetrics` private since all access happens via methods anyway.

title: Add the .tal extension to TAL file names while installing.
body: Fixes #518.

title: Fix delta generation. Increase serial number.
body: Let’s not talk about this one …

title: man page description for `fresh`
Re-introduce refreshing the log output for the /log endpoint.
body:
This PR re-introduces refreshing the log output used by the `/log` HTTP endpoint. This got lost during the refactoring of the payload data.

Fixes #520.

title: Introduce optional per-client RTR metrics.
body:
This PR changes the RTR server to collect metrics on a per-client basis and exposes these optionally via the usual endpoints if the `rtr-client-metrics` option is enabled.

All connections with the same source IP address are considered to be the same client.

The metrics are not included by default to avoid accidentally leaking information about the internal network structure if the HTTP server is publicly available.

This resolves #334.

title: Introduce conditional HTTP request to the RRDP client.
body:
This PR adds processing of conditional requests via Etag and Last-Modified to the RRDP client, allowing to skip downloading the notification file if it hasn’t changed.

The PR changes the information stored in the database for RRDP repositories and therefore results in database errors. Run with the `--fresh` option once to fix this.

Finally resolves #259.

title: Allow input for the validate command from and output to a file.
body:
This PR adds a new `--input` option to the `validate` command to read a list of route announcements from a file or standard input. It reads either JSON or a simple plain text format. It also adds `--output` to redirect output to a file.

Resolves #430.

title: Introduce ’jsonext’ output format. Rename filter options.
body:
This output format includes more detailed information about the source of a VRP.

The PR also uses the opportunity to refactor the output code. As part of it, it renames the `filter-asn` and `filter-prefix` options for output generation (both command line and HTTP query) to `select-asn` and `select-prefix` as I was thoroughly confused about what they do. The new name should be more obvious. The old names are still accepted as aliases.

Resolves #435.

title: Updated APNIC TAL
body: As per the request of @geeohgeegeeoh

title: Make RRDP fallback random between refresh and rrdp-fallback-time.
body:
This PR picks and stores a random time between the refresh time and rrdp-fallback-time (which can never be smaller than twice the refresh time) upon each successful update of an RRDP repository. When updating fails, it will fall back to rsync after that time.

Resolves #492.

title: Exit the server when a fatal error happens.
body: This PR changes the engine the exit its processing loop if an error happens. It also moves the check into the inner loops so the threads exit faster in this case.

title: Parse URL encoded query parameters in /validity HTTP endpoint.
body: Fixes #466.

title: Refactor origins module into payload module.
body:
This PR replaces the `origins` module with a `payload` module and refactors the module as well as adjacent functionality. The main purpose is to prepare for inclusion of RPKI data beyond route origin validation such as ASPA or BPGSec router certificates. No such functionality is provided yet but it can be added later without breaking changes to the library crate’s API.

This is also some of the oldest code and it shows. So refactoring and cleaning it up certainly is a worthwhile endeavour.

The PR fixes #461.

title: Build with no default features (second attempt).
body:
Reqwest needs a feature to enable TLS but since features are cumulative, we can’t swap out one for another. Luckily, reqwest supports multiple TLS backends at the same time, so now we always include `rustls-tls` and let `native-tls` include that backend and let the HTTP client explicitly choose its backend based on the presence of the `native-tls` feature.

The previous attempt always included OpenSSL on vanilla Unix systems which caused build failures on minimal installations.

title: Use --locked everywhere to ensure that Routinator builds consistently.
Bundle more TALs and rearrange init to allow choosing TALs.
body:
This PR adds a few more optional TALs and changes TAL handling to make future additions easier. It also changes the `init` command to allow the user to select the TALs they want to have installed.

This resolves #363.

title: Gracefully handle bad manifest file entries.
body: The new validation code forgot to deal with bad manifest file names. This PR corrects this oversight.

title: Bump minimum supported Rust version to 1.45.
body: This requires the Docker build image to use Alpine 3.13.

title: Always enable default-tls for reqwest.
body:
This allows Routinator to build with `--no-default-features`.

Fixes #411.

title: Remove deprecated config items.
body: Fixes #417.

title: Clean and update dependencies.
body: This removes some unused dependencies and `cargo update`s the whole shebang.

title: Produce per-repository metrics.
body:
This PR introduces a whole lot more metrics related to publication and validation. The already existing metrics over VRPs are now also provided per repository. In addition, metrics over the number and status of published objects are available per TAL, per repository, and overall.

Fixes #338.

title: Optionally store RRDP responses somewhere.
body:
This PR introduces the `rrdp-keep-responses` option that allows providing a directory in which the content of successfully received RRDP responses is stored. The URIs are turned into a path. For notification files, the URI is turned into a directory and the notification file is stored under the timestamp when it was retrieved.

Resolves #476.

title: Further improve RRDP metrics.
Conditional processing for VRP endpoints of the HTTP server.
Add additional status information to RRDP repository metrics.
body: This partially fixes issue #477.

title: Clear validation log after cleanup is done.
body: Currently, the cleanup log shows in `/log` as the first thing of the next validation run. And that is wrong.

title: Forward-port the Routinator UI from the series-0.8 branch.
body: Forward-port the Routinator UI from the series-0.8 branch.

title: New command 'dump' to dump the data from store and collector.
body: Since data isn’t stored plainly on disk anymore (apart from that collected via rsync), this new command makes it possible to get to it anyway.

title: Update the default for rrdp-fallback-time to 3600s
body:
This was the originally intended default.

Also adds the new config option to the man page.

title: Update pkg workflow to reflect upated dev version naming policy.
RRDP Collector: Always store the repository state information under the same key.
body: This fixes a bug where delta updates where re-tried again after being applied and then failed.

title: Send Last-Modified response header field with validation result (fixes #469)
Use a sled database for the RRDP collector.
body:
This RP replaces the current file-based scheme for storing the local copy of RRDP repositories with a sled database.

See `src/collector/rrdp.rs` for a description of the strategy.

title: Rename cache to collector.
body:
This is purely cosmetic to free up the term cache for the full data set managed by Routinator in line with the `cache-dir` option.

The RRDP cache/collector has not been renamed as it will be fully re-implemented.

title: Also accept a string for the exceptions config file value.
body: Fixes #464.

title: Add --fresh to wipe all local data before starting.
body: This option can be used in case of a database corruption.

title: Support gzip encoding for fetching RRDP data
body:
An `accept-encoding: gzip` is added to RRDP requests and responses with
`content-encoding: gzip` are decompressed automatically by reqwest.

Fixes #459.

title: Release 0.8.3
Separately store acceptable RPKI data.
body: This PR introduces the concept of a _store_ that maintains a set of RPKI data from accepted publication points, ie., those with a valid manifest and all objects on the manifest present and correctly hashed. The store is updated from a _cache_, which synchronizes data with upstream repositories if they have new data this is acceptable.

title: fix typo in README.md
Prepare for release 0.8.3-rc1. Once more with feeling.
Prepare for 0.8.3-rc1, now with correct version.
body: Previous PR had version 0.8.3 in Cargo.toml.

title: Prepare for release 0.8.3-rc1
Include version 0.1.0 of routinator-ui.
body: Note: This PR is _not_ for main but for the _series-0.8_ branch and will result in Routinator 0.8.3.

title: Manually set std listeners sockets to non-blocking.
body:
This is necessary because `tokio::net::TcpListener::from_std` won’t do it and so we block.

(This is a bug fix for not-yet-released code; no changelog entry necessary.)

title: Upgrade to Tokio 1.0-based crates.
body: This introduces one regression for now: We don’t set TCP Keepalives for RTR anymore because the API for it has been removed from Tokio.

title: Move to new arrangement of rpki-rs.
Prepare for release 0.8.2.
Prepare for release 0.8.2-rc1.
Update locked dependencies.
Don’t invalidate an entire CA if objects themselves are invalid.
body: This PR changes validation so that a CA will only be rejected if its manifest or CRL are invalid or if any of the objects listed on the manifest are either missing or have the wrong hash.

title: Provide status as JSON output.
Prepare for release 0.8.1.
Switch logging in update command.
Force the branch built to be 'main', not 'HEAD'.
body:
Without this message the following appears to users:
  "warning: fetching `master` branch from
  `https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator.git` but the
  `HEAD` reference for this repository is not the `master`
  branch. This behavior will change in Cargo in the future
  and your build may break, so it's recommended to place
  `branch = "master"` in Cargo.toml when depending on this
  git repository to ensure that your build will continue
  to work.
  Installing routinator v0.8.0-bis (https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator.git#93030960)"

That seemed recoverable, but at the end:
----------- snip -----------------
error: failed to run custom build command for `routinator v0.8.0-bis (/home/morrowc/.cargo/git/checkouts/routinator-cce357cafb9b8c32/9303096)`

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `/tmp/cargo-install0eExb4/release/build/routinator-ad30741a4da162f3/build-script-build` (exit code: 101)
  --- stderr

  You are using an outdated branch of the Routinator repository.

  The default branch is now "main".

  Please run 'git checkout main' before building.

  thread 'main' panicked at 'explicit panic', build.rs:8:5
  note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
-------------- end snip ----------

So, adding an appropriate (main suggested in output) branch
seems useful/required :)

title: Add package repo instructions to readme
body: Maybe it needs a reference to the location of the config file as well?

title: Prepare for release 0.8.1-rc1.
Improve log output formatting for unsafe VRPS.
body: Fixes #405.

title: Allow integer for rtr-tcp-keepalive config value.
body:
For the moment, this this patch allows both integers and strings for the `rtr-tcp-keepalive` config file entry. This will be changed to allowing an integer only with the next breaking release.

The change also adds a test that tries parsing the output of the `config` command to hopefully avoid similar mistakes in the future.

Fixes #418.

title: Add starting date to HTTP /log output.
body: Fixes #419.

title: Drop locally filtered VRPs.
body: Fixes #423.

title: Fix config file key name of unknown-objects.
body:
Fixes the config file key for the unknown objects option to use a dash instead of an underscore. The broken spelling is still allowed and will be removed in 0.9.

Originally reported and fixed by @johannesmoos in #413.

title: For Issue#414 - handle roa=/32 and prefix < /32.
body:
For cases where the ROA is host-route and a .0 host, if the prefix to compare
is a network at the same .0 the current code fails to understand
validity rules.

ie:
  218.188.106.0/32 - ROA
  218.188.106.0/24 - network to compare.

title: Prepare for release 0.8.0.
Prepare for release 0.8.0-rc2.
Show the status code instead of -1 in RRDP status metrics.
Don’t generate origins two different ways.
body: This fixes (a) unsafe filtering not happening on all but the first validation run, and (b) some metrics not being updated.

title: Better log message for resources marked as unsafe.
Prepare for release 0.8.0-rc1.
Correctly determine the entry for a CRL in the manifest.
Add unknown-objects policy for dealing with unknown object types.
body: This allows changing the policy on how to deal with unknown object types. It currently defaults to warn and ignore so as to not block the introduction of new object types until the new manifest rules have been codified.

title: Move filtering of unsafe VRPs behind an option.
body: Fixes #391.

title: Validate EE .cer files as router certificates.
body:
Fixes #398.

The bulk of the changes is in https://github.com/NLnetLabs/rpki-rs/pull/113

title: Follow new, stricter CRL rules.
body:
This modifies CRL handling to only allow exactly one CRL per CA which must be the one mentioned on the manifest’s EE certificate.

Fixes #395.

title: Rearrange and clean up logging.
body:
Adds a proper definition for all log levels (see the man page). Revisits the log level of all log messages to comply with that definition.

Makes logging from the last validation run available via the HTTP service.

Fixes #383.

title: Set panic to abort for release builds.
body: Fixes #382.
